definitions.definition: To oxidize or discolor due to oxidation .
examples: Careful storage of silver will prevent it from tarnishing .

definitions.definition: To compromise , damage , soil , or sully .
examples: He is afraid that she will tarnish his reputation if he disagrees with her.

definitions.definition: To lose its lustre or attraction ; to become dull .
To use a sign , image , expression , etc. sufficiently close to a trademarked one that it brings disrepute to it.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To oxidize or discolor due to oxidation .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To compromise , damage , soil , or sully .
( intransitive , figurative ) To lose its lustre or attraction ; to become dull .
( copyright law ) To use a sign , image , expression , etc. sufficiently close to a trademarked one that it brings disrepute to it.
